thread.title: Old acquaintance: Cuadrado returns to the Champions League
thread.title_full: Old acquaintance: Cuadrado returns to the Champions League

author: world today news
title: Old acquaintance: Cuadrado returns to the Champions League
text:
This Thursday, September 19, Atalanta will appear for the first time in this new edition of the Uefa Champions League, when the Italian team will face Arsenal as a visitor, after those led by Gianpiero Gasperini enter this competition after winning the Europa League the previous season.
However, this clash against the English will be a turning point for Juan Guillermo Cuadrado’s return in the Champions League, remembering that he was with Inter Milan last season but was not very successful with the Neroazuros.
In this way, we are going to review what the Colombian defender’s numbers were like in the main club competition, taking into account that he has already played with Chelsea, Juventus and Inter Milan.
Juan Guillermo Cuadrado Numbers – Champions League (SOFASCORE)
Chelsea (Season 14/15)
Games played: 1
Goals: 0
Assists: 0
Juventus (Season 15/16)
Games played: 8
Objectives: 1
Assists: 0
Juventus (Season 16/17)*
Games played: 12
Objectives: 1
Helping 1
Juventus (Season 17/18)
Games played: 6
Objectives: 1
Helps: 1
Juventus (Season 18/19)
Games played: 5
Goals: 0
Helps: 1
Juventus (Season 19/20)
Games played: 6
Objectives: 1
Helps: 1
Juventus (Season 20/21)
Games played: 6
Goals: 0
Helps: 6
Juventus (Season 21/22)
Games played: 7
Goals: 0
Assists: 0
Juventus (Season 22/23)
Games played: 6
Goals: 0
Helps: 1
Inter Milan (Season 23/24)
Games played: 2
Goals: 0
Assists: 0
* Played in the Champions League final but was suspended
Now Cuadrado’s possible debut could happen this Thursday, September 19, when Atalanta hosts Arsenal on the first date, a duel that will be at 2 : 00 pm Colombian time.
Juan Guillermo Cuadrado in the Champions League.
